title: Question:
author: Baofeng
created_time: July 11, 2022, 10:06:17 PMLast edit: May 21, 2023, 10:46:05 PM by Baofeng
content: So Teo Lopez is back, after the humiliating lost against George Kambosos, he is making his comeback, but this time he has move up in weight. He will be fighting a dangerous and experience boxer in Campa next month.Quote“I’m thankful to be back August 13. I’ve been looking forward to this since my last fight,” Lopez said. “I’ve had a lot of complications, but we’re looking towards the future and are on to bigger and better things. I’m here to take over the 140-pound division just like I did at 135. Like always, I’m going to bring excitement to the sport of boxing. The Takeover is still in full effect. You don’t want to miss it.”https://www.boxingscene.com/teofimo-lopez-pedro-campa-full-undercard-set-august-13-las-vegas--167578Another good match making on the part of Top Rank, in paper it appears that Campa is a good match against Lopez. True, but I think Lopez will beat him convincingly at 140 lbs and then Teo making some noise in this 140 lbs division. Unified champion Josh Taylor has relinquished some of the belts he have, and there will be elimination and interim fights and maybe Lopez will figure in one of those to have a belt in this division.

comments.author: btc_angela
comments.body: So Lopez is campaigning to 140 lbs now, let's see if he can bring his power to this division. Although I think he will, but it will depend on the quality of the opponent that he is facing, specially true 140 lbs.And speaking of this division, as mentioned, the 140 lbs unified champion Josh Taylor has defended one of his belt to his mandatory and it was really close that there are arguments that he lost again Jack Catterall.

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: What do you expect? He is under Top rank which is good at somewhat making their fighters good specially after a big lost. So I would agree that this is a cherry pick fight for Lopez entering a new territory at 140 lbs. So no more big fights for Haney or Davis at 135 lbs. Although we have seen Davis fight at this division already and winning a belt against a weak champion. Good for Lopez if he can win this fight and then call the other champion and established himself again.

comments.author: TopTort777
comments.body: Does anyone know what cause Lopez to move to other weight division? Last Canelo fight showed, that being so self confident and moving to other division ends bad. Why not try to regain belts back? What was all that shouts "I am the best", after winning Lomachenko, for ? Why not make make a second fight against Lomachenko, I am sure Loma will instantly accept it. Or a rematch with Kambosos ?

comments.body: A good test for Lopez to prove if he's able to fight in super lightweight divison, Pedro Campa is unknown boxer, but his last fight was impressive since he won via KO from the boxer who never loss before.Quote from: TopTort777 on July 12, 2022, 08:33:25 AMDoes anyone know what cause Lopez to move to other weight division? comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: Quote from: TopTort777 on July 12, 2022, 08:33:25 AMDoes anyone know what cause Lopez to move to other weight division? Last Canelo fight showed, that being so self confident and moving to other division ends bad. Why not try to regain belts back? What was all that shouts "I am the best", after winning Lomachenko, for ? Why not make make a second fight against Lomachenko, I am sure Loma will instantly accept it. Or a rematch with Kambosos ? Even before the Kambosos fight, Teofimo and his dad were already planning to move up in weight to fight undisputed champion Josh Taylor. Teofimo wanted to become the first undisputed champion in 2 divisions. Although in reality, Teofimo never became undisputed in lightweight since former WBC champion Lomachenko was elevated into a WBC franchise champion while former WBC interim champion Devin Haney became the WBC champion. The new WBC franchise belts were not well-received and were never credited by the hardcore boxing community. After losing his belts to Kambosos, his dad mentioned that they will continue to their to move up. There was no rematch clause too because it was a mandatory fight that went into a purse bid.The arrogant father and son duo also dismissed a Loma rematch before the Kambosos fight. They're not man enough. They forgot that Lomachenko donated personal money of around $800,000 to them as additional payment because they demanded more money, something promoter Bob Arum cannot satisfy due to the pandemic. And Teofimo barely beat an injured version of Lomachenko who undergo surgery right after the fight.I hope this unknown Pedro Campa upsets Teofimo Lopez. Quote from: Jawhead999 on July 12, 2022, 02:26:56 PMThe champion on the lightweight division are really though too, Haney and Tank.There's only 1 legit champion in the division. Haney already collected all 4 belts in the division plus the Ring belt. Tank is a fake WBA regular champion just like the WBC franchise belt, otherwise, Haney is not undisputed.

Perhaps his body is really growing and have problems making the desired 135 lbs. Looking at his frame, it's a natural process that he will have to grow and can't make that weight anymore. So for sure that is one reason that they decided to go up to 140 lbs. Although 135 lbs has a lot of champions in Davis and Haney, but eventually this two will also have to go and move up and Lopez will have the advantage since he is the first one to do it. Even Ryan Garcia might be targeting this weight. in his fight against Tagoe, it is on a catch weight of 138 lbs. So this is a good move for Teofimo Lopez.

comments.body: LOL! Nice choice of an opponent for Teofimo Lopez. With all his loud mouth he ends up fighting against an unknown hermit from Mexico. This is going to be his first fight after that terrifying loss in November last year, after all. We'll see whether Teofimo is really making a come back in this fight.
